abstract: Dish Network says it will not submit a new bid for Sprint Nextel. | Federal and state regulators take divergent stances on the consulting industry. | In acquiring Waze, Google is aggressively pushing regulatory boundaries. | The Jefferies Group reports weak bond trading results.
snippet: Dish Network says it will not submit a new bid for Sprint Nextel. | Federal and state regulators take divergent stances on the consulting industry. | In acquiring Waze, Google is aggressively pushing regulatory boundaries. | The Jefferies Group re...
lead_paragraph: Dish Network said on Tuesday that it would not submit a new takeover bid for Sprint Nextel ahead of the 11:59 p.m. deadline and would instead focus on its bid for a stake in Clearwire. That apparently leaves Sprint free to complete the sale of a majority stake to SoftBank of Japan for $21.6 billion, DealBook’s Michael J. de la Merced writes.

abstract: The legal settlement over Class C shares, says the author, is a messy solution for a problem that need not exist in the first place.
snippet: The legal settlement over Class C shares, says the author, is a messy solution for a problem that need not exist in the first place.
lead_paragraph: Google shareholders are getting some modest future-proofing.

headline.main: Google’s Shareholder Bulwark for the Future
